attributes.action: All consumables, must by law have a biodegradable time scale stated them.
attributes.background: If for example "Bio 1mo" or "Bio 600yr" had to be printed or stamped on consumables by law.  Making consumers see how long their item will take to biodegrade may make ppl think twice. Biodegradable is a misinterpreted word, by stating actual time scales consumers can make an informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: We are killing our planet, slowly suffocating it. People still do not like to be told what to do, by putting the ball back in their hands, letting them make the choice by actually seeing what effect their lifestyle has in real time may make ppl think more and make better chioces.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave children under 13 home alone
attributes.background: There is currently no age restriction for a child being given the responsibility of staying at home alone as long as it’s not overnight and that isn’t “in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering or injury to health”.
attributes.additional_details:
This is NOT right, there are a range of issues including safeguarding of children. As parents and carers we have a duty to our children.

The petition is aimed to try to implement a law that states that no child under the age of 13 should be left alone at any given time, the reason for this is due to safeguarding and putting a huge responsibility on children regardless of their mental age. We are not allowed to leave children alone overnight and the same rules must apply throughout the day too. I understand a child must be given due responsibility but under the age of 13 should not be allowed due to risks and safety.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. We’re asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school don’t add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: End Equal Opportunities Question about your race when applying for jobs
attributes.background: When applying for a job vacancies in the UK the employer always state that they are an equal opportunity employer and  you are required to state your ethnic minority group. Now this give the employer the opertunity discriminate against prospective employees the election  process.
attributes.additional_details: People from ethnic minority groups are being discriminate against whilst applying for job vacancy online In the pre selection process by employer. The question about stating what ethnic minority group you are from should be omitted from online application forms all together. If you are applying for a job that you are qualified for the question about your race shouldn't be of importance to the employer for selection. I applied for the same job with the same details but change my race from one to next and recieve a call the following day.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Bring in a recognised standard of safety for installation of blinds.
attributes.background: For years the blind industry has the good and the bad installers, which is the same in a lot of industries but this can be the case of life or death when cords are involved.
attributes.additional_details: There are many cases of children losing their lives to poorly installed blinds due to the cording.

attributes.action: Make Pads and Tampons Free
attributes.background: Because why should women have to pay so much money for a natural occurrence. People would be against women walking around with period blood everywhere so why should we have to pay!
attributes.additional_details: Once I started my period in a public toilet and the tampons were  £1 for 2 tampons. This is outrageous.

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html

attributes.action: Funding home visits in times of crisis by trained mental health professionals
attributes.background: After a local woman tried to take her life, the community were left horrified in discovering proper professional help was not available to her, and she was left for hours before receiving the help she needed.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling for more funding and correct training for these circumstances so that no one needing help in times of crisis are left without it. This woman was fortunate to have a strong community of neighbours who were able to help her.

It's easy to point the finger and say people in need should seek help, but what happens when the help just isn't there?

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Scrap the MOT test.
attributes.background: The MOT test is outdated and does not save lives but only costs motorists money.

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Provide option to pay an extra 10 to 20% Council Tax & choose where it's spent.
attributes.background:
With all the cuts to services I suggest people are given the OPTION to pay an extra 10, 15 or 20% on their Council Tax via a tick box AND be able to choose where the money is allocated via a few more tick boxes i.e.
- Policing
- NHS
- Schools
- Local Town Council
- Social Services
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us are unhappy & frustrated with the spending cuts that have impacted so many services. There is too much emphasis on keeping Council Tax down without giving people the OPTION to pay more if they want to and have a say in where it is spent. 

I would be happy to pay an extra 10% provided it went on local policing and I am sure many people who could afford it would feel the same, albeit with differing priorities.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for assisted living facilities in care homes.
attributes.background: How much do you think care homes cost per week? You'd be surprised to find out the national average is £600, excluding nursing. This high price tag does not match the quality of the services provided. Help us to change this, as well as your possible future.
attributes.additional_details: We are Team Ward from Preston NCS - Wave 4. NCS, which stands for National Citizen Service, is a programme which encourages young people to engage in social action and make a difference in society. Recently, we visited a local care home. We were shocked at the visible lack of staff to help support the service users when we arrived. After this experience, we decided we were going to try and make a difference by starting this petition.

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Prevent those in Public Service from withholding data
attributes.background: Data laws are being used to cover up & block complaints. Organisations and public bodies should have to prove in court that a request is vexatious before they can refuse to give information. The ICO should be given the funds and powers to fully investigate non-compliance with the law.
attributes.additional_details: Those who don't fully comply with a request in 1 calendar month must be fined. The impact on those who suffer failure, abuse and hostility is worse if they can't access all their records to pursue a complaint. It affects the most vulnerable, those on low incomes who may not be able to access public services e.g. housing, disabled facilities, innocent children forced out of school, school bullying covered up that may lead to children self-harming or children/individuals targeted by authorities.

attributes.action: No more than 1 junction or 5 miles of roadworks, on a motorway or  A road
attributes.background:
This causes a lot of congestion and stand still traffic, there is more likely to be a road traffic incident in roadworks. 
Most of the time road works are only been worked on in a 1 mile stretch, there is no need for so many miles to be closed for years and years
attributes.additional_details:
M6- over 20 miles of motorway 2 miles of workers max, incidents at least 1 aday, 
M5 1 junction 2-3,bridge repairs hardly any incidents and not as much congestion

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Have a Nicola Sturgeon statue in Westminster
attributes.background: I would like a Nicola Sturgeon statue built in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Make Football compulsory for all schools across the UK (Public and State)
attributes.background: Football is the biggest sport in the world with over 1/3rd of England watching the World Cup games that England were involved in. Some children do not get the chance to play football and excel at the sport, public and state schools.
attributes.additional_details: Every pupil deserves the chance to be involved in a team sport, where it is not physical like rugby, which some students do not want to partake in due to fear of injury.

attributes.action: Create a medal for those injured or killed whilst in service or on operations
attributes.background: I want the introduction of a medal to be automatically awarded to those members of the UK armed forces, and security and emergency services injured or killed whilst serving in any capacity during the course of their service or whilst on operations

attributes.action: Protect pension funds from asset strippers by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees. However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.
Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company. 
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered.

attributes.action: Public transport(bus) to have cabin filters to protect passengers and drivers
attributes.background: high pollution is danger for all of us, the cabin filter will protect and save lives
attributes.additional_details: it was a few documentary on tv shown that danger (heavy) car emission are cumulated in public transport like tram and buses. The ventilate is not an option, a proper pollen filter will make a different and it will save some lives, and help

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.

attributes.action: Make affordable fixed-price meals mandatory in all Primary & Secondary Schools
attributes.background: I'm concerned that some Primary / Secondary Schools are using a system wherein pupils buy their own meals (or packaged goods such as sandwiches, wraps or pasta) in a cafe-style shop, which are individually priced and set at exorbitant prices which would be costly for most parents, long term.
attributes.additional_details: A possible solution could be an amendment to the Education Act to state that school meals prices must be capped at a level affordable to low and middle-income earners and Primary / Secondary Schools must deliver affordable School Meals below that limit.

attributes.action: Leave with No Deal if Parliament rejects the EU Withdrawal Agreement.
attributes.background:
The UK have already had a 'peoples vote' - The result was clear, the people voted to leave the EU.

If Parliament votes to reject the withdrawal agreement, the government must honour the result of the referendum and leave with NO DEAL.
attributes.additional_details:
The people voted to leave, the two year notice period is coming to an end.

Quite simply we must walk away.

Only then can we re-start negotiations for a better future.
Project fear believers and Business leaders will crow about the chaos and devastating effects, but maybe just maybe its time for some new thinkers and new Business leaders.

Lets remember the UK is a WORLD LEADER in many areas, full of people with an abundance of fantastic entrepreneurial spirit.

attributes.action: Set up Independent Pricing Watchdog to Stop Excessive Prices at the Fuel Pumps
attributes.background: When oil prices change, UK drivers have absolutely no idea what they will pay at the pumps. It is never ever the same! There is no consistency, logic or clarity to the way prices are calculated. If gas, electricity, water & telecoms get pricing bodies, why not motorists too? We need ‘PumpWatch’.
attributes.additional_details: FairfuelUK found that on Nov 23, oil was priced £45 per barrel. In the last 2yrs, when oil hit this price on 30 different occasions, pump prices varied bizarrely from £1.35 to £1.18 for diesel and £1.26 to £1.16 for petrol. Between Oct 3rd to Nov 23rd, oil fell 31.33% from £66 to £45/barrel. But in the same period, retail profits/litre rocketed by 139% for petrol and 205% for diesel. In Oct 2018, nearly £1/2bn in wholesale fuel price falls were held back from the economy and consumers at the pumps.

attributes.action: Hard Remain: Align with other EU countries and adopt Schengen and the euro.
attributes.background: Many people are unhappy with the various varieties of brexit that are on the table. But many are also unhappy with the current membership of the EU. Another option would be for a "hard remain". The UK should become part of the Schengen area, adopt the euro currency, and adopt EU driving standards.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-biodegradable cigarette filters in the UK.
attributes.background: Cigarette butts are the most common form of man-made litter in the world. It is estimated that 4.5 trillion cigarette butts become litter every year. The fibres used as the predominant filter material do not readily biodegrade. A normal lifespan of a discarded filter is thought to be up to 15 years!
attributes.additional_details: Banning the sale of certain materials is an effective way to force manufacturers to create alternatives. Fines have not stopped individuals from littering (just look at the floor on your own high-street!). Manufacturers won't change from cheaper, more environmentally damaging materials unless their hand is forced. So, let's force their hands!

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped

attributes.action: Increase threshold for considering a petition for debate from 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: 100,000 signatures is not a true reflection of the population, and should not be debated in parliament. Present day we have 67 million people in the UK and so 1% of the population would be a more realistic figure. This then can be reviewed every 10 million the population increases.I

attributes.action: Change age limit for large engine cars as it is for motorbikes
attributes.background: I want it changed as is for motorbikes so young people can not drive cars above a 1.2 engine till they are 25 so can help reduce risk of fatal or life changing injures
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was in car crash with young lad at wheel in large engine car and crashed car ended up on roof and she was injured two broken ankles deep cut to leg and now has too have two surgery

attributes.action: £85,000 turnover to remain non-taxable after becoming VAT registered.
attributes.background: For small businesses to grow allow taking of £85,000 (VAT threshold) to be non-taxable and exempt from VAT. Only make business pay 20% VAT on takings which exceed the threshold and not on the total taxable turnover. Currently becoming VAT registered as a small business is financially crippling.

attributes.action: 65% majority referendum to approve the offer to leave EU or else stay in the EU
attributes.background:
Lisbon Treaty Art 50 in effect needs 65% of remaining population to approve a state leaving. Therefore 65% of population leaving should approve
UK Companies Act 2006: 75% vote to change rules that govern its conduct with members. We are considering the relationship between the UK and its citizens
attributes.additional_details:
2016 Referendum result: Leave 17,410,742 – 51.89%; Remain 16,141,241- 48.11% – just 3.78% in favour.  This has been, and continues to be, a most divisive and disproportionate margin for the well being of the UK and its citizens

When the 2016 referendum was taken the campaign was generalised slogans and proclamations and could not clearly set out specific consequences and realities: which were at the time impossible to know. Now we know them

To end division and animosity we need clear majority

attributes.action: Redirect UK's funds from backup power subsidies to invest in renewable energy.
attributes.background:
ECJ rules UK backup power subsidies are illegal.

These subsidies counterproductively give funds to fossil fuel generators.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.jurist.org/news/2018/11/ecj-rules-uk-backup-power-subsidies-are-illegal/#

http://curia.europa.eu/juris/document/document.jsf?text=&docid=207792&pageIndex=0&doclang=en&mode=req&dir=&occ=first&part=1&cid=1430154

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/nov/15/uk-backup-power-subsidies-illegal-european-court-capacity-market

https://uk.investing.com/news/commodities-news/uk-must-halt-backup-power-scheme-after-eu-court-ruling-1382121

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/30/ban-coal-backup-power-subsidy-scheme-scottishpower

attributes.action: Funding/ Installation of Wildlife Crossings (Eco Bridges)
attributes.background: We should be funding safe alternatives for animals to pass over or under our busy dangerous roads. We build these roads through their habitats and offer nothing to prevent thousands of animals deaths occurring each year. Something must be done to help protect our struggling wildlife population.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of successful Eco Bridges are in The Netherlands (over 66 crossings), Australia, Germany, California, Florida, Canada and many more. All have been successful in increasing numbers in wildlife.
The 4 ways that roads negatively impact wildlife: 1 decrease in habitat, 2 increase mortality due to wildlife-vehicle collisions, 3 prevent access to resources on the other side of the road, and 4 they subdivide wildlife populations into smaller and more vulnerable sub-populations.

attributes.action: Make using someone else’s pictures on dating sites a criminal offence
attributes.background: Using someone else’s photos and private details on social media, dating sites and sex sites should be illegal. It causes distress to the person being impersonated, can be used in a malicious way like I have had done to myself.
attributes.additional_details:
I have had my photo uploaded, nick name only family members know me by, location and made up sexual interests added to sex dating sites claiming I’m unhappily married. By someone I know. 

At the moment there is no law against this but this needs to change as it causes so much hurt and embarrassment, and is a nasty form of bullying. 

People are also lured in by the photo and think they are talking to this person when they actually aren’t which again just causes hurt and embarrassment.

attributes.action: Lower the age at which men can claim the state pension.
attributes.background: In an age of total equality, surely it is only fair and right that men and women enjoy a similar amount of time in retirement. As life expectancy for men is, on average, 4 years shorter than for women, surely they (men) should be able to claim their state pension 4 years earlier.

attributes.action: Stop UK Government foreign aid to India
attributes.background: UK’s global aid commitment is in the countries national interest, but when £330 million is squandered on a giant bronze statue in India it must be seriously evaluated whether that money could not better be spent at home.

attributes.action: Improvement of animal welfare labelling on all animal or animal produce products
attributes.background: Displaying shocking pictures like that on smoking packets of the welfare standards for the worse welfare foods and a rated system on all animal produce/meat foods. Legal labelling for all foods and restaurants including foods incorporating meat or produce.
attributes.additional_details: Our labelling of meat sold in supermarkets is awful. We have the red tractor and we have RSPCA assured. I am very annoyed that we still sell caged chicken eggs, why? To save the consumer a matter of pence, at the detriment to the animal, then you have “free range” which doesn’t always mean that their welfare is higher than that of a caged chicken.

attributes.action: Exempt Start-Up Businesses from the SME R&D Tax Credit Payment PAYE Restriction.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain looks to lead the world in technological innovation, for many start-up businesses, the SME R&D Tax Credit payment provides a vital source of cashflow.  Companies that are carrying out genuine R&D should not be penalised for being unable to afford to hire permanent staff.

attributes.action: Make the date of leaving the eu our uk independance day
attributes.background: When we leave the eu it will be a great part of our uk history. So calling it our independance day could be celibrated by future generations.

attributes.action: Ban religious studies in schools
attributes.background: Religion does not belong in the school system. I do not send my child to school to learn about religion - that is what church is for.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Hold banks properly to account over negligent handling of bank card fraud claims
attributes.background:
Banks are currently allowed to deny card fraud claims without providing evidence for their decision to customers.

They are not protecting our money and personal data from card fraud. At a time when large companies suffer mass data breaches this is not acceptable behaviour and should be penalised.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks avoid reimbursing the value of stolen funds, or compensating victims of bank fraud, not least because the Police, Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS) are under-resourced and unable to cope with a growing epidemic of digital crime.

Government should:

- ask the FCA to conduct an investigation into this issue;
- amend the law to allow the FCA or FOS to issue fines in individual cases; and
- better resource the Ombudsman to conduct further investigations.

attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.
